docstring.long_description:
**Compatibility:**
Compatible with National Instruments devices that utilize NI-DAQmx. Tested with a simulated NI-9219 module.

This block is designed for use with Windows and Linux systems due to NI driver availability. Ensure you have installed the NI-DAQmx runtime from [NI-DAQmx Download Page](https://www.ni.com/en/support/downloads/drivers/download.ni-daq-mx.html).
docstring.short_description: Creates a task with channel(s) to measure temperature using a thermocouple.

parameters.name: cDAQ_start_channel
parameters.description: The device and channel to read from.

parameters.name: cDAQ_end_channel
parameters.description: To read from only one channel, set this to the same as `cDAQ_start_channel`. To read from multiple channels, set this to the last channel you want to read from.

parameters.name: min_val
parameters.description: Specifies in **units** the minimum value you expect to measure (default is 0.0).

parameters.name: max_val
parameters.description: Specifies in **units** the maximum value you expect to measure (default is 100.0).

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: The units to use to return thermocouple measurements (default is "Celsius").

parameters.name: thermocouple_type
parameters.description: The type of thermocouple being used (default is "J").

parameters.name: cold_junction_source
parameters.description: Specifies the source of cold junction compensation (default is "Constant").

parameters.name: cold_junction_value
parameters.description: Specifies the cold junction temperature in **units** if `cold_junction_source` is set to "Constant" (default is 25.0).

parameters.name: cold_junction_channel
parameters.description: Specifies the source of cold junction compensation if `cold_junction_source` is set to "Channel" (default is "").

returns.description: This block does not return any meaningful data; it is designed for creating a task to measure temperature using a thermocouple.
